The query is executed using either {@link #findAll()} or + * {@link #findFirst()} * + * The input to many of the query functions take a field name as as String. Note that this is not + * type safe, so if a model class is refactored care has to be taken to not break any queries. + * This is not optimal, but it is our current best compromise between ease of use and type safety. * * A RealmQuery cannot be parsed between different threads. * - * @param The class of objects to be queried + * @param The class of the objects to be queried. + * @see Builder pattern + * @see Realm#where(Class) + * @see RealmResults#where() */ public class RealmQuery {

diff --git a/.gitlab-ci.yml b/.gitlab-ci.yml
index 3e5f6a9..2b763ed 100644
--- a/.gitlab-ci.yml
+++ b/.gitlab-ci.yml
@@ -1,6 +1,6 @@
 image: node:14
 
-test:
+tests:
   script:
     - npm install
     - npm run test
@@ -8,3 +8,20 @@ test:
   only:
     - main
     - merge_requests
+
+code_scan:
+  image: sonarsource/sonar-scanner-cli
+  script:
+    - sonar-scanner
+  only:
+    - main
+    - merge_requests
+    - feature/*
+
+security_scan:
+  image: aquasec/trivy:latest
+  script:
+    - trivy filesystem --exit-code 1 --no-progress /
+  only:
+    - main
+    - merge_requests
